raw.title: [BIP-529] Enable sFRAX-sfrxETH gauge [Optimism]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/737

**Summary:**

> We request adding sFRAX/sfrxETH weighted pool on optimism to BAL gauge as an uncapped core pool 

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to
> • [Website](https://frax.finance/)
> • [Documentation](https://docs.frax.finance/)
> • [Github Page](https://github.com/FraxFinance/frax-solidity)

**Protocol Description:**

> sFRAX is a staked interest bearing version of FRAX stable coin and  sfrxETH is a staked interest bearing version of FRAX's staked ETH (frxETH). 

**Motivation:**

> As a joint effort with FRAX and Beethoven X, we aim to increase liquidity of FRAX, sFRAX, frxETH, sfrxETH, to make Balancer a liquidity hub for frax assets on optimism. The BAL gauge and core pool status will facilitate the process.

**Specifications:**

1. **Governance:** FRAX governance process can be seen [here](https://docs.frax.finance/smart-contracts/governance) and their snapshot [here](https://snapshot.org/#/frax.eth).
2. **Oracles:** Rate provider contract for [sfrxETH](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xf752dd899F87a91370C1C8ac1488Aef6be687505) and for [sFRAX](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xDe3B7eC86B67B05D312ac8FD935B6F59836F2c41).
3. **Audits:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/other/audits)
4. **Centralization vectors:** see [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/overview).
5. **Market History:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/frxeth-and-sfrxeth)
6. **Value:** Balancer will earn the protocol fee on interest bearing sFRAX and sfrxETH in the pool and so will LPs. The BIP-19 flywheel will incentivize TVL to grow here with trading volume and our staked ethereum pillars will continue to have Balancer as their ideal liquidity destination.

Link to pool: https://op.beets.fi/pool/0x2feb76966459d7841fa8a7ed0aa4bf574d6111bf00020000000000000000011d
Link to child gauge: https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x758D3297d9D9325EFb6DD424a7B2EdCaB47e309E
Link to root gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0x8c596E8D1b3Be04a6cAa1B1152b51c495f799a16#code

**Specification:**

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0x8c596E8D1b3Be04a6cAa1B1152b51c495f799a16`
gaugeType(string): `Optimism`

Additionally, this pool is requesting `core pool` status as per BIP-457

choices: No, this is not the way

### PR with Payload

**References/Useful links:**

**Motivation:**

> As a joint effort with FRAX and Beethoven X, we aim to increase liquidity of FRAX, sFRAX, frxETH, sfrxETH, to make Balancer a liquidity hub for frax assets on optimism. The BAL gauge will facilitate the process. 

**Specifications:**

2. **Oracles:** Rate provider contract for [sfrxETH](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xf752dd899F87a91370C1C8ac1488Aef6be687505), the pool does not rely on additional oracles.

6. **Value:** Balancer will earn the protocol fee on interest bearing sfrxETH in the pool and so will LPs. The BIP-19 flywheel will incentivize TVL to grow here with trading volume and our staked ethereum pillars will continue to have Balancer as their ideal liquidity destination.

Link to pool: https://op.beets.fi/pool/0x478980c67d53cd990f2b7bab311ddc9934324e7b00020000000000000000010c

gauge(address):`0x057e7b14DC461f071958e0BbF42b5597564D4e6C`

Additionally, this pool is requesting `core pool` status as per BIP-457

raw.title: [BIP-530] Enable sFRAX-FRAX gauge [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payloads
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/738

**Summary:**
> We request adding sFRAX/FRAX pool on Arbitrum to BAL gauge as an uncapped core pool

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to:
> • [Website](https://frax.finance/)
> • [Documentation](https://docs.frax.finance/)
> • [Github Page](https://github.com/FraxFinance/frax-solidity)

**Protocol Description:**

> FRAX is a decentralized stablecoin by Frax Finance, and [sFRAX](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-v3/sfrax) is a staked interest-bearing version of FRAX stablecoin. 

**Motivation:**

> The sFRAX-FRAX pool on Arbitrum is a key strategic tool in developing the Frax Finance ecosystem and enhancing the liquidity of both FRAX and sFRAX. By establishing this pool, Balancer has the potential to become a central hub for Frax asset liquidity on Arbitrum. Implementing the BAL gauge and core pool status will significantly facilitate this process, furthering our shared goals in the DeFi space.

**Specifications:**
 
1. **Governance:** FRAX governance forum can be seen [here](https://gov.frax.finance/) and snapshot [here](https://snapshot.org/#/frax.eth).
2. **Oracles:** Rate provider contract for [FRAX](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x0809E3d38d1B4214958faf06D8b1B1a2b73f2ab8) and for [sFRAX](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x03e4054B11ad01915257bE53Af03A32Abf7837b9).
3. **Audits:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/other/audits)
4. **Centralization vectors:** see [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-v3/sfrax).
5. **Market History:** See [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/frxeth-and-sfrxeth)
6. **Value:** Balancer will earn the protocol fee on interest-bearing sFRAX in the pool, and so will LPs. 

Pool: https://arbiscan.io/address/0xdfa752ca3ff49d4b6dbe08e2d5a111f51773d395

Child Gauge: https://arbiscan.io/address/0x7dc6C96bf1c0ce2e5Ddad5601AFeCC0207b0870C#readContract

Root Gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0x2aBd1863C84CdfEA63581D5b4BAb89B690B39DdF#code

**Specification:**

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0x2aBd1863C84CdfEA63581D5b4BAb89B690B39DdF`
gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

Additionally, this pool is requesting `core pool` status as per BIP-457

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-451] Enable wstETH/rETH/sfrxETH gauge [Optimism]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/547

**Summary:**

> This pool uses the composable stable pool factory v5 and contains three unique staked ethereum tokens, staked frax eth (sfrxETH), wrapped staked eth from Lido (wstETH), and rocket eth from Rocket pool (rETH). As most Balancer community members know, rocket pool and lido have become pillars of the ecosystem through the use of the metastable / composable stable pool types to leverage their yield bearing assets. Staked frax eth will be joining these two juggernauts to facilitate trading and LPing amongst these diverse staking strategies of ETH. This gauge would enter as a “core pool” under BIP-19, meaning protocol fees earned by this pool would be used to bribe for votes on it.

**References/Useful links:**

> (sfrxETH) Link to:
> • [Website](https://app.frax.finance/)
> • [Documentation](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/frxeth-and-sfrxeth)
> • [Github Page](https://github.com/centrehq/centre-tokens)
> • [Communities](https://facts.frax.finance/frxeth/validators)
> (wstETH) Link to:
> • [Website](https://stake.lido.fi/)
> • [Documentation](https://blog.lido.fi/)
> • [Github Page](https://github.com/lidofinance)
> • [Communities](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/lido-dao)
> (rETH) Link to:
> • [Website](https://rocketpool.net/)
> • [Documentation](https://docs.rocketpool.net/guides/)
> • [Github Page](https://docs.rocketpool.net/developers/usage/contracts/contracts.html#introduction)
> • [Communities](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/rocket-pool)

**Protocol Description:**

> sfrxETH is a Frax’s staked wrapped ETH token, wstETH is a wrapped staked ETH token for Lido, and rETH is the staked ETH token for Rocket Pool.

**Motivation:**

> Balancer is clearly pushing forward on all networks with staked assets as a key focus. By diversifying the protocols which supply staked assets Balancer opens up the door to liquidity providers to gain exposure to multiple providers, while facilitating trade routes for these assets. The protocol benefits greatly from yield bearing assets, and Balancer’s users do just as much. This pool will be a unique and diverse group of Ethereum assets making it exciting for everyone involved.

**Specifications:**

1. **Governance:** Find more information about governance on each projects forum. [sfrxETH ](https://gov.frax.finance/), [wstETH](https://research.lido.fi/), [rETH](https://medium.com/rocket-pool/rocket-pool-staking-protocol-part-2-e0d346911fe1)
2. **Oracles:** See each rate provider contract linked here respectively [sfrxETH](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0xf752dd899F87a91370C1C8ac1488Aef6be687505), [wstETH ](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x9aa3cd420f830E049e2b223D0b07D8c809C94d15), [rETH](https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x658843BB859B7b85cEAb5cF77167e3F0a78dFE7f)
3. **Audits:** See [sfrxETH](https://docs.frax.finance/other/audits), [wstETH](https://github.com/lidofinance/audits), [rETH](https://medium.com/rocket-pool/rocket-pool-staking-protocol-part-4-2635c44e4f7e).
4. **Centralization vectors:** Rocket Pool is a [protocol for decentralized and trustless ETH2 staking](https://medium.com/rocket-pool/rocket-pool-staking-protocol-part-1-8be4859e5fbd). For Lido and wstETH please read [here](https://lido.fi/faq). Lastly for FRX and sfrxETH see [here](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/overview).
5. **Market History:** See [rETH](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/rocket-pool-eth), [wstETH](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/wrapped-steth), and [sfrxETH](https://docs.frax.finance/frax-ether/frxeth-and-sfrxeth)
6. **Value:** Balancer will earn the protocol fee on all assets in the pool and so will LPs. The BIP-19 flywheel will incentivize TVL to grow here with trading volume and our staked ethereum pillars will continue to have Balancer as their ideal liquidity destination.

Link to pool: https://op.beets.fi/pool/0x5F8893506DDC4C271837187D14A9C87964A074DC000000000000000000000106
Link to child gauge: https://optimistic.etherscan.io/address/0x5669FB0DCfA758Bf69FB3AdAB14578EDe14cc89A
Link to root gauge: https://etherscan.io/address/0x6A2C2d4502335638d2c2f40f0171253fb2c2db88#readContract

Specification: 

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0x6A2C2d4502335638d2c2f40f0171253fb2c2db88`
gaugeType(string): `Optimism`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal to enable the sfrxETH/cbETH Balancer pool and gauge on Base has unanimous strong support in voting timeline metrics, positive market reaction during the event window, and limited but cautious forum discussion. Historical similar proposals showed unanimous approval but resulted in negative market impacts, advising careful monitoring post-adoption. The recommendation is to approve the change to support liquidity and protocol growth.
key_arguments_for: Strong and stable voting lead for 'Yes, let's do it' throughout the voting period.
Positive token price (+4.28%) and TVL (+3.75%) impact during the event window.
Proposal enhances liquidity and incentivizes TVL growth for Frax assets on Base.
Aligns with Balancer's strategic interest to be a liquidity hub for staked Ethereum assets.
key_arguments_against: Forum discussion shows some negative sentiment cautioning about risks and centralization.
Historical similar proposals resulted in negative post-vote price and TVL impacts, signaling potential downside risks.
Limited community discussion before the deadline may indicate less broad engagement.

evidence.quote: Two comments: one negative caution about risks and one neutral informational post.
Unanimous support with 100% lead ratio for 'Yes, let's do it' option across all quartiles.
Price impact +4.28%, TVL impact +3.75% indicating positive reception.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Voting timeline metrics show unanimous, stable, and early support for enabling the sfrxETH/cbETH pool.
- Positive market impact during the event window signals community and market confidence.
- Forum sentiment is cautiously negative but limited, not opposing the proposal strongly.
- Historical similar proposals had unanimous approval but negative post-vote market impacts, suggesting a need for monitoring but not outright rejection.
- Recommendation aligns with aggregated vote sentiment and market signals, supporting a change for long-term growth and liquidity benefits.
